alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 1:10AM EDT until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Rouge River Near Dearborn Heights affecting Wayne County. .Heavy rainfall over the last 24 hours has caused a rapid rise on the Middle Rouge River. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Middle Rouge River Near Dearborn Heights. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...Forecast will be for the river to rise toward 11 feet this morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Impact...At 10.0 feet, Edward Hines Drive will be under 5 feet of water in low lying spots, closing travel completely. Some sewers will begin to backup due to the river. Water will reach some roads and backyards. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
